name: Topics in French Literature: Encountering Foreign Cultures: Travel Writing in French
description: An examination of the trends and attitudes embodied in French travel writing over time. The course considers aspects of utopianism, cosmopolitanism, exoticism, imperialism, postcolonialism and ethnography in fictional and non-fictional narratives set 'elsewhere'. Selections are drawn from writers such as Lahontan, Gautier, Nerval, Gide, Loti, Segalen, Camus, Bouvier and Baudrillard.
